what reasons did mark give about why human beings are drawn toward the instinct to “play?” play engages us in all three dimensions. play engages us in all three dimensions. play engages us in all three dimensions. play engages us in all three dimensions. play engages us in all three dimensions. play engages us in all three dimensions. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play produces a sense of joy and wonder. play inspires our imagination and our effort. play inspires our imagination and our effort. play inspires our imagination and our effort. play inspires our imagination and our effort. play inspires our imagination and our effort. play inspires our imagination and our effort. all of the above all of the above all of the above all of the above all of the above all of the above

when it comes to the 1st dimension, what types of things typically should a parent be focused on to help their athletes develop? references dweck, c. (2007). mindset: the new psychology of success. new york, ny: ballantine books. isbn-13: 978-0345472328. jambor, t. van gils, j. (2007). several perspectives on children’s play: scientific reflections for practitioners. garant uitgevers n v. isbn-13: 978-9044121834. stoll, s.k. beller, j. m. (2004). male/female student athletes’ moral reasoning: seventeen year study results and key points. retrieved from: https://www.webpages.uidaho.edu/center_for_ethics/measurements/hbvci/findings.htm webb, m.t. an exploration of the relationship between moral reasoning and leadership style of athletic team coaches. regents university. 2008. https://books.google.com/books?id=gv0kbxl8yhac&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false

recommended reading click to order click to order click to order click to order click to order click to order should i sign up our seven-year-old son for the travel team? what should we do about our daughter’s sunday morning games? am i the only one longing for a sane balance between children’s sports, family time, and church commitments? overplayed: a parent’s guide to sanity in the world of youth sports offers good news for parents stressed out by these questions and stretched thin by the demands of competitive youth sports. the authors believe that youth athletics should be a learning laboratory for wholesome relationships and character development. in 3d coach, dr. jeff duke shares his own journey through the three dimensions of coaching and how it has impacted his life and those around him. he also shares the personal stories of coaches from all levels who have implemented the 3d concept into their own programs. click to order click to order click to order click to order click to order click to order
